bwwExcerpt: This is not a reinvention of the 1947 play, as the casting conceit might suggest. Nor is it a revelation in terms of startling new takes on familiar characters. It tends to under-serve the pathos while more assiduously exploring the humor and sensuality. But while itâ€™s uneven, this is a muscular staging driven by four compelling, sexy lead performances and a sturdy ensemble.
